entry.title: Through Fire and Time II (9-1-1 x 9-1-1: Lone Star Fanfic)
entry.summary:
Author: actuallynate

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,592Chapters: 3/31Kudos: 6

Summary: Same number, different city.Elliot "Eli" Hayes thought he had found stability and belonging with the 126 in Austin - a firehouse that helped him heal from his past and grow into his role as a paramedic. But life, as unpredictable as ever, throws him a curveball when a sudden reshuffle forces him to temporarily leave the comfort of the firehouse family and take up a position with the 118 in Los Angeles.Returning to his hometown stirs up old memories, unresolved grief, and unexpected challenges. With his panic disorder still a lingering shadow, Eli must navigate the dynamic and high-pressure environment of the 118 while proving himself to a new team.Meanwhile, his close friend, Ravi Panikkar, struggles to find his footing at the 252 firehouse in New York under the shadow of Captain Sal Deluca, a once respected leader whose toxic ways threaten to unravel Ravi's confidence and safety.TRIGGER WARNING: This story contains themes of panic disorder, hypochondria, and anxiety attacks, as well as references to trauma, medical procedures, suicide, drug names and high-stress emergency situations. Reader discretion is advised.

entry.title: that something lovers call fate
entry.summary:
Author: theramblingwriter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,857Chapters: 2/17Kudos: 5

Summary: Buck and Eddie first meet in 2016 when Eddie needs a partner to drive with him and his son from El Paso to LA where he's moving to be with his girlfriend and start a new life with the LAFD.He doesn't think he and Buck are destined to be friends. They probably won't think about each other again.Two years later Buck and Eddie run into each other when Eddie is at a cafe with his wife.Buck wonders if this is the universe giving them a second chance to get to know each other. Neither of them take it.Three more years pass by before they meet again.Eddie transfers to the 118 after his divorce, and Buck's still mourning an unexpected breakup with his girlfriend… but this time, things just seem to click.

entry.title: Haunted by the ghost of you
entry.summary:
Author: Bumblebee2020

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,310Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 25

Summary: Evan Buckley has always been able to see ghosts, to the point if it weren't for his sister he would've been medicated.He meets Eddie Diaz when he's 22, they fall in love at 26, Eddie Diaz dies at 30 years old when a structure collapses."I can't see him Maddie, I...""Christopher?" Buck shakes his head as the weight in his chest grows. "You think maybe..."Buck shook his head harshly."No, he wouldn't without saying goodbye.... I haven't seen any of them since he died... it's like the world went quiet.""Buck..." Christopher whimpers as he walks into the living room. "I can't..."Buck nods and hugs him too, tight against his chest.~"I'm still here..."

entry.title: Badly Beaten Self Esteem Has Got Me Needing You
entry.summary:
Author: bvddiesbro

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,631Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 67

Summary: Who did he think he was anyway, strolling into the 118 with his hair and his body and his eyes, with a smirk that bled confidence. Who did he think he was to appear and insert himself into their family like he belonged when Buck himself had grafted, scraped and clawed his way to belonging.He could feel Bobby’s eyes on him, he could feel Hen wanting to reach out, could feel Chimney’s confusion but they didn’t understand. This, the firehouse, this team, this family was his. It was all Buck had. They didn’t understand how threatened he felt, his hackles raised and chest tense everytime Bobby clapped Eddie on the shoulder. They didn’t know about the nausea that clawed at him every time Chimney poked fun at Buck, with Eddie. They couldn’t fathom the way his head spun every time Hen complimented Eddie on his skills as a medic, sounding genuinely impressed.OrBuck has some serious undiagnosed mental health issues, pushes them aside and becomes everyone's sounding board, soaks up their problems and ignores his own, until he can't anymore.OrBuck slowly realises that maybe he's not a burden, that he doesn't need to make his problems smaller to make room for others.

entry.title: in the pink
entry.summary:
Author: pickdotter

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,694Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 111

Summary: “If I tell you to lay down, would you?” That’s an odd question to make its way out of his lips. Eddie rubs the collar of the cardigan between the fingers of his free hand.“What?” Buck says, under his breath.“Lay down, Buck. Then we’ll talk.”After what is a rather short pause, Buck drops his gaze to the bed. He swallows. His face glows a pretty shade of pink.It matches, thinks Eddie.//Eddie's supposed to throw Buck out of his house. Instead, the pink cardigan drives Eddie crazy.

entry.title: L is for the way you Lose Me
entry.summary:
Author: FantasyandFlowers

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,144Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 9

Summary: “Buck, have you seen Eddie?” Bobby sounds panicked.“What- no? Have you?”“No, where are you now?”“I’m at his house; it looks like someone destroyed it,” Buck’s voice falters, shaking with each word. Why is Bobby so terrified?“He’s not at home?” Bobby asks with a serious tone.“No, what’s going on?” Buck asks. Suddenly, the world is spinning; this is all wrong. Eddie should be here. Where is he?“They just found Eddie’s car abandoned on the side of the road.”“No.” Buck starts shaking his head. This can’t be happening. No. Eddie was headed home to talk to Christopher last night. He wasn’t supposed to go anywhere else.“Stay there, kid. I’m already on my way to you,” Bobby says.“Where’s Eddie?” Buck asks. He knows it’s childish, a pointless question that Bobby can’t answer.“We’ll find him,” Bobby reassures.orEddie is getting ready to move to Texas, but why can't he shake this feeling he has towards leaving Buck behind? Buck wants to tell Eddie how he feels, but he would never ask Eddie to choose between him and Christopher. But they both lose their chance to confess anything when Eddie is mysteriously kidnapped with no leads.

entry.title: Amazingly Perfect Match
entry.summary:
Author: Jackaroony

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,560Chapters: 3/12Kudos: 6

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley MAR. 4th 11:03:13 AM “Do I really have to talk right now? Fine, Maddie, if you are watching, I’m sorry if you saw what happened yesterday; feel free not to consider me a brother anymore. As for my friends at 118, please tell me you didn’t see that. I begged you not to watch! By the way, you guys see all of the footage, right? Could you tell me who left the water on my nightstand? You can’t or won’t because I can see in your eyes that you know who I should thank to...” Edmundo “Eddie” Diaz MAR. 4th 11:13:41 AM “How could I leave him alone? I tried to put him in his bed, but he kept pushing me away, calling me Bobby and Cap. In the end, I stopped trying and let him sleep on the floor. If not for the smell of alcohol, he would remind me of my son when he refuses to go to sleep. Please, don’t tell him that I left the glass of water on his nightstand. I know that he doesn’t like me for who knows what reason, but it felt wrong to leave him when the girl he spent the night with did. They what?!”-The relationship between Buck and Eddie didn't start Amazingly, but in the end, they realized that they were a Perfect Match.

Author: Mortain16

Summary: When Eddie finally asked Buck to marry him, it felt like everything had finally fallen into place. Their family was already built, and their love was already proven.But perfection is fragile.One mistake. One look at Christopher’s face, and suddenly everything Eddie thought was unbreakable starts to crack. And before he can even explain, before he can even try to fix it—Buck is gone. entry.title: Whatta Man
entry.summary:
Author: GoodeGoose

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,554Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 69

Summary: They were a family, and family teases each other.Specifically, for the past week they’d been teasing Buck and Eddie by doing things like making kissing noises at them when their legs brushed in the cab of the firetruck, having Bobby (the traitor) put their portions of lasagna for team dinner in the shape of a heart, and very loudly wolf-whistling when Eddie and Buck walked towards Buck's jeep together at the end of their most recent shift. All of these things had caused the two of them to be varying degrees of flustered, being equal parts embarrassed and endeared.And then there was today.

entry.title: You Can Tell The Story Coldly (But Don't Say I Didn't Love You)
entry.summary:
Author: astromirage

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,872Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 92

Summary: “One would think that passing out and falling out of a fire truck would be enough of a wake up call,” Bobby huffs, “Buck, I know Eddie leaving is hard,” Buck’s lip wobbles at the mention of him, “but doing what you’re doing isn’t going to help anyone.”Buck shrugs, looking away, for some god forsaken reason, anger bubbles in him, stupid childish anger, and he wipes his face roughly. I don’t want to be this way, he thinks, but the spiral slipped out of control before I could catch it. And I’m too tired to stop it now.
